projects.title: RM Full-Series Auto-Aiming Code
projects.description: Full-series auto-aiming code for Fudan University RM Team EGA, including auto-aiming, prediction, and ballistic compensation, developed based on the TJURM-2024 framework. The team eventually won the 1v1 Championship at the Shanghai Regional that year, and secured the First Prize among non-top-tier teams in the 3v3 Battle Tournament after reaching the quarterfinals.

projects.title: LaCSR5: Efficient SpMV Optimization Based on CSR5
projects.description: In the National Collegiate Computer Systems Ability Competition (Operating System Track – OS Function Challenge), the team, representing Fudan University as 'This is a Team', proposed and implemented the LaCSR5-SpMV algorithm. The project optimized CSR5-based Sparse Matrix-Vector Multiplication for the Loongson 3A5000 architecture, leveraging SIMD instructions and multi-core features. Tested on 23 sparse matrices, the algorithm achieved up to 2.78× performance improvement. Awarded Second Prize.

projects.title: Game Console Development Based on ESP32 and Arduino
projects.description: A game console developed using ESP32 and Arduino, programmed in C. Contributed to soldering components and designing the acrylic case, wrote and flashed onboard game programs, successfully completed an 8-button simple game console, and co-authored the development process documentation. Later became a simplified teaching project for the Youth Volunteer Team.

projects.title: forgoten poem: RPG independent exploration game
projects.description: An RPG independent exploration闯关游戏， using Unity engine, using C# language. Creative level design
